definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The most common method of ditching is done by use of a ditching machine.
sentences.chinese: 使用挖土機是最常用的挖溝方法。

sentences.english: Mechanical excavation is carried out by a variety of machines, including the shovel and drag- line excavator.
sentences.chinese: 機械挖掘採用多種工具，如鐵鏟和索鏟挖土機。

sentences.english: Later in the day, he watched backhoes destroy homes that he was told belonged to ethnic Georgians.
sentences.chinese: 數天後他目睹了挖土機推到了格魯吉亞裔族的家園。

sentences.english: It 5)tumbled off the shovel of their front-loader.
sentences.chinese: 當時，這個銅像從挖土機的剷鬥中滾落了下來。

sentences.english: Only hand-held equipment shall be used for construction and excavator shall not be used.
sentences.chinese: 建造工程只可採用手提設備，不得使用挖土機。

sentences.english: Loaders and shovels easily dig common excavation without blasting.
sentences.chinese: 裝載機和挖土機能夠不需爆破就進行普通的挖掘。

sentences.english: A backhoe is often used in ditching where the soil conditions are usually rough.
sentences.chinese: 在地面凹凸不平地區也常用反剷挖土機挖溝。

definition: all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
dichlorvos C4H7Cl2PO4, organic phosphate used as insecticide (loanword)/also called dimethyl dichloro-vinyl phosphate DDVP
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to cut ties/to disconnect/out of touch
